intro: Trichinium calostachyum, commonly known as the golden cup plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Trichinium calostachyum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
